questions.question_text:
You take your database backups by using the RMAN media management interface (MMI).
Which two are true about the use of the RMAN MMI? (Choose two.)

comments.content:
Rman can only create image copies or backup sets 
BC is correct

discussion.content: I think answer C and D

choices.D: You can use it to create proxy copies for database files.
choices.B: You can use it to create image copies for database files.
choices.C: You can use it to create backup sets for database files.
choices.A: You can use it to create image copies for entire file systems.
choices.E: You can use it to create proxy copies for entire file systems.

questions.question_text:
database, you attempt to load data into the HR.EMPLOYEES table in a pluggable database (PDB):
$> sqlldr hr/hr@pdb table=employees
Which three are true? (Choose three.)

discussion.content:
BCD, question 40 can help with this answer

https://www.examtopics.com/exams/oracle/1z0-063/view/8/
BCD - not A because SQL Loader does not create table.

comments.content: D is also true if hr was create with container=all

choices.C: It loads data into HR.EMPLOYEES if the table exists in the PDB to which HR connects.
choices.A: It creates the HR.EMPLOYEES table in the PDB and loads data into it if the table does not exist in the PDB to which HR connects.
choices.E: It loads data into HR.EMPLOYEES if the table exists in CDB$ROOT.
choices.D: It succeeds if HR is a common user.
choices.B: It succeeds if HR is a local user in the PDB to which HR connects.
